issue.title: CMake Error - C++14 support for the library

content.raw:
Could you let us know which version of Ubuntu you're using (e.g. 14.04, 16.04, etc)? ~~I'm assuming you're using Ubuntu if the compiler is GCC. Also, you could you let us know what version of `gcc` and `g++` you're using? If this error is correct, then it sounds like you're using an old version of `g++` that doesn't support C++14.~~ Never mind, I just realized the GCC version is mentioned as 4.9.4 in the error message. Let me check what features that offers.

A temporary workaround that may help you get Gazebo working quickly would be to switch the `ign-math` branch to `ign-math3`. In your `ign-math` source directory, run the bash command:

`$ hg up ign-math3`

After that, continue with the build instructions as detailed in the tutorial. If that doesn't work, then you might be using a version of Ubuntu which is older than what the current Gazebo supports, and you might need to use an older version of Gazebo.
content.html:
Could you let us know which version of Ubuntu you're using (e.g. 14.04, 16.04, etc)? I'm assuming you're using Ubuntu if the compiler is GCC. Also, you could you let us know what version of gcc and g++ you're using? If this error is correct, then it sounds like you're using an old version of g++ that doesn't support C++14. Never mind, I just realized the GCC version is mentioned as 4.9.4 in the error message. Let me check what features that offers.

A temporary workaround that may help you get Gazebo working quickly would be to switch the ign-math branch to ign-math3. In your ign-math source directory, run the bash command:

$ hg up ign-math3

After that, continue with the build instructions as detailed in the tutorial. If that doesn't work, then you might be using a version of Ubuntu which is older than what the current Gazebo supports, and you might need to use an older version of Gazebo.
